items.name: Pacific Crest Trail
items.description: A long-distance hiking trail that runs from the Mexican border through California, Oregon, and Washington to the Canadian border. Offers diverse landscapes from desert to alpine mountains.
items.notes: Did a section hike in Oregon. Absolutely stunning views and well-maintained trails. Challenging but rewarding.

items.name: Appalachian Trail
items.description: One of the longest hiking-only footpaths in the world, extending from Georgia to Maine. Passes through 14 states and numerous parks and forests.
items.notes: Hiked a portion in the Smoky Mountains. Beautiful forests and wildlife. Trail was a bit crowded in some sections.

items.name: Zion Narrows
items.description: A gorge hike in Zion National Park, Utah, where the walls are a thousand feet tall and the river is sometimes just twenty to thirty feet wide.
